docs.text: Table of contents Introduction About Markdown Basic Syntax Introduction Markdown is used for writing this website. So, the first thing I need to learn is about Markdown Language. About Markdown Figure 1. Markdown icon lightweight markup language was created by John Gruber in 2004 Basic Syntax This section notes about Markdown basic syntax. Insert a picture in Markdown: ![picture_name](direction_to_picture) Insert a hyperlink: [Name](Link) . Hyperlink is used in References in this note. Code and emphasize C syntax: int main() { printf( Hello world! ); return 0; } Quote (put ' ' before writing quote): This is example of quote Horizontal Rule: put a horizontal rule in doc by typing *** , see result below Task list (do not success by now) [x] Write the press release [ ] Update the website [ ] Contact the media Inserting a figure to docs: refer About Markdown in this page for example !!! note with "admonition" in mkdocs.yml add markdown_extensions: -admonition to mkdocs.yml file. Read more at Markdown Extentions Markdown Extentions Got information about markdown extentions at https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/extensions/admonition/ PyMdown https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/extensions/pymdown/ References The Markdown Guide - Matt Cone Markdown Guide - Website Basic writing and formatting syntax - GitHub

docs.text: MkDocs documentation Using mkdocs for documentation. More detail about this tool at MKdocs Getting started mkdocs new my-project - Create a new project Deploy in Github Page This document will be published in Github Page. To do this, you need: Create a repository in github with name: vutang.github.io Clone this repo to local machine In local machine, use command: mkdocs gh-deploy --config-file ../mkdocs-vux-note/mkdocs.yml --remote-branch master Test with local webserver use mkdocs serve to run local web server in your browser, access http://127.0.0.1:8000 Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files. Support Themes The list of supported themes for Mkdocs https://github.com/mkdocs/mkdocs/wiki/MkDocs-Themes Readthedocs: readthedocs Material: material Readthedocs-DropDown: rtd-dropdown - trying but not really successful by now, need to figure out what happens Material
docs.title: Mkdocs Tool
